definitions: dramatic work characterized by exaggerated emotions and stereotypical characters
behavior or events marked by exaggerated emotions or sensational incidents
examples: The Victorian melodrama featured a villain twirling his mustache menacingly
Silent films often relied on melodrama to convey emotional depth
She turned the minor disagreement into an unnecessary melodrama
His resignation speech was pure melodrama designed for media attention

definitions: sequence of musical notes forming the main theme of a composition
any pleasant succession of sounds or harmonious arrangement
examples: The melody of the song stayed in her mind all day
He hummed a familiar melody while washing the dishes
The melody of birdsong filled the morning garden
Her voice had a natural melody that charmed listeners

definitions: large round fruit with sweet watery flesh and hard rind
trailing vine plant that produces melon fruits in the gourd family
examples: She served chilled watermelon slices on the hot summer day
The cantaloupe melon was perfectly ripe and sweet
The farmer planted several varieties of melon in the greenhouse
Melon vines spread quickly across the prepared garden bed

definitions: substance that has been changed from solid to liquid by heat
act or process of becoming liquid through application of heat
examples: The chocolate melt was perfect for dipping strawberries
Pour the cheese melt over the nachos while still hot
The spring melt flooded the valley with rushing water
Scientists studied the glacier melt to understand climate patterns

definitions: severe overheating of a nuclear reactor core causing radiation release
sudden loss of emotional control resulting in extreme distress or anger
complete failure or collapse of a system, organization, or market
examples: The Chernobyl meltdown remains history's worst nuclear power plant accident
Safety protocols prevent reactor meltdowns through multiple cooling systems
The toddler had a complete meltdown in the grocery store
She experienced an emotional meltdown after months of stress
The financial meltdown of 2008 affected global markets severely
The company faced a meltdown after the data breach scandal

definitions: process of changing from solid to liquid state through heat application
gradual emotional softening or becoming more sympathetic and tender
examples: The melting of polar ice caps accelerates with rising temperatures
Chocolate melting requires careful temperature control for best results
His stern expression showed signs of melting when he saw the puppy
The melting of her resistance came after his heartfelt apology

definitions: water released by melting of snow or ice especially from glaciers
examples: Meltwater from mountain glaciers feeds the river system below
The sudden release of meltwater caused devastating floods downstream
Scientists analyze ancient meltwater to study past climate conditions
Spring meltwater provides crucial irrigation for valley farms

definitions: person belonging to a group, organization, or community
limb or organ forming part of a human or animal body
constituent part of a structural or architectural framework
examples: She became a member of the tennis club last month
All members must pay their annual dues by December
The surgeon examined the injured member for signs of infection
Physical therapy helped restore function to the affected member
The wooden member cracked under the excessive weight load
Each structural member was inspected for signs of deterioration

definitions: state or status of being a member of an organization or group
all the members of an organization considered collectively as a body
examples: Her membership in the professional association enhanced her credentials
Annual membership includes access to all facilities and programs
The membership voted unanimously to approve the new bylaws
Club membership has grown significantly over the past decade

definitions: thin flexible tissue forming a barrier or lining in organisms
thin pliable sheet of material serving as a barrier or filter
examples: The cell membrane regulates what enters and exits the cell
Mucous membranes line the respiratory and digestive tracts
The waterproof membrane prevents moisture from penetrating the roof
Engineers developed a synthetic membrane for water filtration systems

definitions: humorous image, video, or text rapidly spread through internet sharing
unit of cultural information transmitted from person to person by imitation
examples: The cat meme went viral within hours of being posted
She created a meme using the popular template format
The meme of individualism spread throughout Western culture
Dawkins coined 'meme' to describe how ideas replicate culturally

definitions: object kept as a reminder of a person, place, or event
examples: She kept the concert ticket as a memento of their first date
The museum displays mementos from the historic expedition
His desk drawer contained mementos from his travels abroad
The locket served as a precious memento of her grandmother

definitions: brief written message or note used for internal business communication
examples: The manager sent a memo about the new office policies
Please read the memo regarding tomorrow's schedule changes
She drafted a memo summarizing the meeting's key decisions
The confidential memo was leaked to the press yesterday

definitions: written account of personal experiences and memories by the author
examples: Her memoir chronicles her journey from poverty to success
The war veteran published a memoir about his combat experiences
Celebrity memoirs often top the bestseller lists each year
He spent retirement writing a memoir for his grandchildren

definitions: objects collected and treasured for their historical interest or personal associations
examples: The baseball memorabilia included signed balls and vintage cards
Beatles memorabilia commands high prices at auction houses
She displayed her theater memorabilia in custom shadow boxes
The museum's war memorabilia collection attracts many visitors annually

definitions: plural form of memorandum referring to multiple written business communications
examples: The executive reviewed several memoranda before making her decision
Legal memoranda outlined the case's key constitutional issues
Department memoranda must follow the new formatting guidelines
These memoranda document the project's entire development history

definitions: formal written message or report used in business or diplomacy
document recording terms of agreement or understanding between parties
examples: The attorney prepared a legal memorandum analyzing the case
She submitted a memorandum proposing changes to company policy
The countries signed a memorandum of understanding yesterday
The diplomatic memorandum outlined the terms for cooperation

definitions: structure or monument erected to commemorate persons or events
ceremony or service held in remembrance of someone who has died
examples: The war memorial honors soldiers who died serving their country
They erected a memorial at the site of the tragedy
The memorial service will be held next Sunday afternoon
Friends gathered for a memorial celebrating her remarkable life

definitions: process of committing information to memory through repetition or study
examples: Memorization of multiplication tables helps students with mental math
The actor's memorization of Shakespeare required weeks of practice
Rote memorization has limitations compared to understanding concepts deeply
Medical students face extensive memorization of anatomical terms

definitions: mental capacity to store and recall past experiences and information
specific recollection of a past event or experience from one's life
computer component that stores data and program instructions for processing
examples: Her excellent memory helped her excel in history classes
Memory decline can occur naturally with aging
That summer remains his fondest childhood memory
The photograph triggered memories of their wedding day
The computer needs more memory to run this software efficiently
Random access memory allows quick data retrieval

definitions: something that presents a threat or source of danger to others
person, especially a child, who causes trouble or annoyance
examples: Drunk driving remains a serious menace to public safety
The invasive species became a menace to local ecosystems
The neighbor's dog is a real menace to postal workers
Her little brother was being a menace during the party

definitions: collection of wild or exotic animals kept for exhibition
diverse or eclectic group of people or things
examples: The traveling menagerie featured lions, elephants, and exotic birds
Victorian menageries were precursors to modern zoological gardens
His office housed a menagerie of unusual collectibles and curiosities
The party attracted a menagerie of artists, writers, and musicians

definitions: place where something has been repaired or patched
process of healing or recovering from injury or illness
examples: The mend in the fabric was barely visible
She examined the mend to ensure it would hold
His broken bone is on the mend according to doctors
The relationship is on the mend after months of counseling

definitions: act or process of repairing damaged items especially clothing
pile or collection of items that need to be repaired
examples: She spent Sunday afternoon doing mending for the family
Traditional mending techniques preserve clothing for longer use
The mending basket overflowed with torn clothes and socks
She sorted through the mending to prioritize urgent repairs

definitions: person employed to do unskilled or routine domestic work
examples: The wealthy estate employed several menials for household tasks
Historical menials often lived in servants' quarters
He started as a menial but worked up to management
The factory menials organized to demand better working conditions

definitions: permanent cessation of menstruation marking the end of reproductive capability in women
examples: She experienced menopause symptoms including hot flashes and mood changes
Hormone therapy can help manage difficult menopause transitions
The average age for menopause is fifty-one years old
Support groups help women navigate menopause challenges together

definitions: sacred seven or nine-branched candelabrum used in Jewish worship and celebration
examples: They lit the menorah each night during Hanukkah celebrations
The golden menorah stands prominently in the synagogue
She inherited her grandmother's silver menorah
The menorah symbolizes the miracle of the temple oil

definitions: person of integrity and honor who acts with wisdom and kindness
examples: Everyone considers him a real mensch for helping strangers
She proved herself a mensch by standing up for justice
In difficult times, be a mensch and do the right thing
The community needs more menschen like her

definitions: monthly discharge of blood and tissue from the uterus in reproductive-age females
examples: Regular menstruation typically occurs every twenty-eight days
She tracked her menstruation cycle using a mobile app
Painful menstruation affects many women's daily activities
Education about menstruation helps reduce stigma and misinformation

definitions: characteristic way of thinking or attitude typical of a person or group
examples: The team's winning mentality drove them to championship success
She criticized the victim mentality that prevented positive change
Corporate mentality often conflicts with creative thinking
The siege mentality made negotiations extremely difficult

definitions: organic compound derived from mint oils producing a cooling sensation
examples: Menthol cigarettes contain mint flavoring that masks tobacco harshness
The cough drops contained menthol to soothe throat irritation
Menthol creates a cooling effect when applied to skin
Many athletes use menthol rubs for muscle pain relief

definitions: brief or incidental reference to something in speech or writing
examples: The article made only passing mention of the controversy
She received an honorable mention in the competition
His mention of the incident surprised everyone present
The report deserves mention for its thorough analysis

definitions: experienced person who guides and advises someone less experienced
examples: Her mentor helped navigate the challenges of starting a business
Young professionals benefit from having industry mentors
He served as mentor to countless students throughout his career
The mentorship program pairs mentors with recent graduates

definitions: list of food and drinks available in a restaurant or meal
list of options or commands available in a computer program
examples: The restaurant's menu features local seasonal ingredients
She studied the menu carefully before ordering
Click the dropdown menu to access additional settings
The software's menu bar contains all editing tools

definitions: characteristic crying sound made by a domestic cat
examples: The hungry cat's persistent meow woke the entire household
She recognized her cat's distinctive meow from outside
The kitten's tiny meow melted everyone's hearts
Multiple meows indicated the cat wanted immediate attention

definitions: economic theory promoting governmental regulation of trade to increase national wealth and power
examples: Mercantilism dominated European economic policy during the sixteenth century
Colonial mercantilism restricted trade to benefit mother countries
The decline of mercantilism coincided with industrial revolution
Modern protectionism echoes earlier mercantilism principles

definitions: professional soldier hired to serve in a foreign army
examples: Medieval kingdoms often employed mercenaries during wartime
The mercenary fought for whoever paid the highest price
Private military contractors are modern mercenaries operating globally
Ancient Greek mercenaries served Persian and Egyptian armies

definitions: goods or commodities offered for sale in retail or wholesale markets
examples: The store's merchandise includes clothing, accessories, and home goods
Holiday merchandise appeared in stores by early October
Damaged merchandise was marked down for quick sale
Online retailers ship merchandise directly to customers

definitions: activity of promoting sale of goods through presentation and marketing strategies
examples: Effective merchandising increases product visibility and sales
The company's merchandising team designed attractive window displays
Visual merchandising transforms shopping into an immersive experience
Sports teams earn millions through merchandising agreements

definitions: person or company involved in wholesale or retail trade of goods
examples: The spice merchant traveled ancient trade routes
Local merchants sponsored the town's annual festival
Online merchants compete with traditional brick-and-mortar stores
Medieval merchants formed guilds to protect their interests

definitions: ship used for transporting commercial cargo rather than military purposes
examples: The merchantman carried precious cargo across the Atlantic
Pirates targeted wealthy merchantmen along shipping routes
During wartime, merchantmen required naval escort protection
The old merchantman was converted into a museum ship

definitions: heavy silvery metallic element that is liquid at room temperature
smallest planet in the solar system closest to the sun
Roman god of commerce, communication, and messengers
examples: Mercury thermometers are being phased out due to toxicity concerns
The mercury in the barometer rose indicating fair weather
Mercury completes its orbit around the sun in eighty-eight days
Surface temperatures on Mercury range from extremely hot to cold
Ancient Romans honored Mercury as patron of merchants and travelers
The statue depicts Mercury with his winged sandals

definitions: compassion or forgiveness shown toward someone within one's power to punish
examples: The judge showed mercy by reducing the sentence
She begged for mercy from her captors
The organization's mercy mission delivered supplies to refugees
His decision showed both mercy and wisdom

definitions: small lake, pond, or marsh especially in Northern England
examples: The village mere attracted various waterfowl throughout the year
Children skated on the frozen mere during winter
The ancient mere had silted up over centuries
Local legends spoke of creatures dwelling in the mere

definitions: combination of two or more companies or organizations into single entity
examples: The merger created the industry's largest telecommunications company
Shareholders voted to approve the proposed merger
The merger faced regulatory scrutiny over antitrust concerns
Post-merger integration proved more challenging than anticipated

definitions: process of combining or uniting multiple elements into one
examples: The merging of traffic requires careful attention from drivers
Data merging consolidated information from multiple databases
The merging of cultures created a vibrant community
Lane merging causes frequent bottlenecks during rush hour

definitions: imaginary line on Earth's surface from North to South Pole
point or period of highest development, greatest prosperity, or splendor
examples: The Prime Meridian passes through Greenwich, England
Ships calculate position using meridians and parallels
His career reached its meridian during the championship years
The empire's meridian lasted nearly two centuries

definitions: light sweet dessert topping made from whipped egg whites and sugar
examples: The lemon meringue pie won first prize at the fair
She piped decorative meringue rosettes onto the dessert
The meringue should form stiff peaks when properly beaten
Baked meringue cookies are crispy outside but chewy inside

definitions: breed of sheep prized for fine soft wool
soft fabric or yarn made from merino sheep wool
examples: Australian merino sheep produce the world's finest wool
The rancher raised merino for their valuable fleece
Her merino sweater provided warmth without bulk
Athletes prefer merino base layers for temperature regulation

definitions: quality of being particularly good or worthy deserving praise or reward
intrinsic value or worth of something independent of external factors
examples: Students receive scholarships based on academic merit
The proposal was evaluated on its technical merit
Each argument should be considered on its own merit
The merit of her research became apparent years later
